name: linux-gravatar
tagline: Set your Linux profile picture using gravatar
body:
linux-gravatar (testing only) ============== --- [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/jrosco/linux-gravatar.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/jrosco/linux-gravatar) Intro ----- Set your Linux profile picture using gravatar. *Version Alpha 0.1.0* **N.B: Only tested on Mint 17 and Ubuntu 14.04** Build/Install/Setup/Run ----- **Clone git repo:** git clone https://github.com/jrosco/linux-gravatar.git **Change directory and run setup:** cd linux-gravatar; sudo python setup.py install **Run application:** python -m linux-gravatar **Setup your settings:** vi ~/.gravatar_settings.cfg **Setting values explained:** email = "The email address used to get your avatar"
check = "The amount of time in seconds to scrape the gravatar url for your avatar"
startup = "Not currently used" **N.B: You need to run the application first before apply the settings, as the application creates the settings file after it is ran.**
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
